column5: Brian, sorry to hear it. Lost my grandda to colon cancer, dad to brain cancer, and mom had an eye removed a couple of years ago because of cancer. The stuff is bad news.
soryr to hear the bad news.  i feel your frustration and pain.  have an unlcel and a father in law both in there earlier 50s with cancer.  Hang in there!

Brian, that is sad news! Perhaps it is an opportunity for you to step up to the plate now and help your aunt and your father. There are some really good resources available at American Cancer Society and also at Canadian Cancer Society  There is a lot of information that will help you to help them.  In the meantime, prayers are sent.  be strong!

Sorry to hear the news Brian. Yes, we're all touched by this incidious disease at some point in our lives. My brother in Toronto was diagnosed with prostate cancer very recently and he was in for surgery yesterday. I should have some news today. My thoughts are with your aunt and your family, Bud.
Good morning and thank you again.

Sorry to hear the news Bri... Hard to understand when the Good ones get Sick, or Pass... when we got all these gangbangers and drug dealers living the easy life...  Take care brother, you'll be in my thoughts for sure.  Gerritt.
Brian, Sorry to hear of the bad news. My thoughts and prayers are with you and your family. Keep your chin up.                                        Marcel
Prayers on the way! So sorry Brian for this terrible news.  Sincerely, Jim
Ya life just is not fair sometimes we lost my mother inlaw in 2002 to colin cancer .I hope your aunt can pull thurough it .  MTP

Sorry to hear and I know your pain!  My father is battling adrenal cancer and has had 2 major surgeries in the matter of 6 months.  They said they got it all the first time when they took out his right side adrenal gland along with his spline and part of his pancreas then after spending 2 months in the hospital they found the cancer had spread to his other adrenal. So another major surgery and now he has bladder cancer.  He is the strongest person I know!!! always positive and takes life one day at a time.  My brothers and sisters have had a really hard time with this but it does bring you close together!! We do not understand Gods plan but he is the almighty and you have to put your trust in him!  Pray for Jesus to give you strength.  I try to kiss my kids and tell them I love them every day because you never know when you will be called to the next life.  My thought are with you, keep your chin up.
Sorry to hear about this, your post was very touching with your passion for life,  All our thoughts are with you.
My thoughts and prayers are with you and your family. I hope your aunt beats this nasty disease and that one day we won't have to worry about it.
Hey Brian,  My prayers are with your Aunt and your family.  Be strong.

I just sent a link of this thread to my aunt to see. Im sure see is going to be very thankful as I told her I have great friends in the fishing community and Im sure this will keep her spirits up.   Thanks again.  Brian
Very sorry to hear this, prayer sent.
Sorry to hear you are going through such trying times.  I hope and wish for you and your family all the strength and spirit to pull through this.

I just recieved this,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,  OH MY GOSH??!!! Thank you Brian! You have such wonderful caring friends. Already started to restore my confidence.Something I don't have alot of lately.  Now I have to wipe up the puddle of tears under my computer!!!  Thank you!!  Love you  Aunt Kathy
It's nice to know that some kind words said can mean so much to someone.  It's certainly a great place here for that.  All the best Aunt Kathy, we're pulling for you.

Brian, From my family to yours, our thoughts and prayers are with you. We understand what your going through, we've had 5 family members die of this disease in the last 6 years..  I don't understand it and we probably never will..  God Bless...  Tiz

You guys prayed for my newlywed husband, I will do the same for you..... Disease is not right, they have to mess with our foods, so many have cancer....... Hang in there, you never do know what Adonai has in store!  Prayers for from me and my hubby..... Lorissa

I remember reading an account of Saint Pio (Catholic Priest) I think....as far as I can recall, an individual asked him to find out from God why he was born blind and the priest said this, "You are blind becuase God knows that this is the only way you will get to heaven". The man's courage returned and left his future in the hands of God. Whatever happens to us in the end be assured that God does care...........he sees the whole picture and knows what is best....trust him even when its very hard to do so. God bless you and your family....
Sorry to hear that Brian - I hope it all works out in the end.  Your family must be tough as nails by now....
Sad to hear Brian...my condolences and prayers.
Prayers sent Brian! Wish there was more I could do. Take care.

As my regular routine when I arrive home ,I grab a cold one and read the family emails,and today I am in shock and am lost.  For those that remember my thread about my grandfather passing,well it seems the next one to feel the wrath is the one that took care of him for so many years.My aunt, whom I just celibrated with and my grandfather before his passing for or birthdays in April ,has been told she has Larynx Cancer.I believe in the powers above and that there is a god,but why would this happen to a women that gave her life to care for her father for so long, be given this burden. It seems when things are getting on the right track,there is always something that tries to take you down again,and again. I feel more for my pop because this is his sister,only sister, and losing his pop and now having to deal with this,I just dont know how to deal with it.It,s becoming very frustating and scary. By god I am so mad right now and Im not afraid to say, that tears are running down my face as I write this,but what in the name of the ol mighty above,does one have to do to.,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,  You smoke, they say you,ll get cancer,you drink you,ll get liver cancer,you BBQ you,ll get cancer,is there anything in the world we cant do so we dont get CANCER????????????????????????????????????????????  I am going to do my darndest to catch pounds for  the cast for cure this year.  I have already given my money to the cause and the wife aswell,and even with that I know it,s  not enough,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,  The wifes not home yet and she is not going to like the news as she is already going through this with her sister,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,  I really have asked for nothing, but your prayers really would be helpful here.It seems to work for others from the board.    He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High, who abides in the shadow of the Almighty, will say to the Lord, My refuge and my fortress; my God, in whom I trust.
Whew.  Me too, Brian, the tears that is.  Prayers?  You got em.  Best to you and your family.

I'm so sorry to hear this Brian.  I know how you feel, as many know on this board (including you) I lost my mother to pancreatic cancer in 04 and my father to lung cancer in 05.  There are way to many stories like this.....  My best to you and your family.  Jim

Really sorry to hear about this Brian and my thoughts and best wishes go out to your aunt and all those who love her.  As you know, I just lost my brother to cancer a few weeks ago, so I know just how your feeling bud.  It'll be a wonderful day when they ever come up with a cure for this horrible disease.
sorry to Hear that  Brian seems everyone everywhere is touched by some close to them having cancer
My thoughts and best wishes are with you Brian I lost a brother to cancer nearly seven years ago and now have a cousin with it. My best to you and your family at this difficult time  Rick
Brain...there are no words.....our prayers are with you and your family......   bly and Cliff
My Mom is a 23 year SURVIVER of Larynx cancer. Keep the Faith!!
I share your feelings we have all had dealings with cancer, I lost my Mother to cancer a few years ago  and a couple of dear friends and relatives. My prayers are with your Aunt for a full recovery.
I'm sorry to hear this Brian, but keep the faih, this may be one they can beat.  Maureen
My prayers go out to you. That's why I always say ENJOY, because it can all be taken away in a heartbeat.
so sorry brian. i had cancer 10 years ago in my mouth. it was friends and family that kept me going. tell her to be strong and believe. dave
My thought's are with you and your family brother.
My thoughts and prayers are with you and your family Bryan.

I'm so sorry to hear about your aunt.  I told my friend just an hour ago to live her life to the fullest today, because if you plan to have fun later, later never comes.  I take care of my mother, by choice, and still live a wonderful life thank goodness. I know I won't be caring for her forever.   There are no guarantees in life.  I wake up every morning thanking the almighty that I have another day to enjoy.  Having friends on the internet helps too.  Pam
Amen to that TY
Thanks all
Brian  I am saddened by the news you just passed to us.  My thoughts and prayers are with you and your family.  John
Sorry to hear about this Brian. It's tough to grasp what has happened and the shock you must feel. Hang in there bud. Everyone is pulling for you and the family.  Tony.
Brian, very sorry to hear the bad news.  Our thoughts and prayers go out to you.
Sorry about the nes Bian..Arm yourself with all the information availble and go from there.Not all cancer is fatal so learn what you can.Prayers are sent from down here. Joe
Prayer sent dude!  dk

Wow B, I just can believe this is happening to your family again.  I don't know the answer either and find it unfair how some people get cancer and never smoke, some people have liver problems and don't drink and the list goes on and on.  They say everything happens for a reason and that God has a purpose for everyone, but some times it just doesn't make any sense.  We're told to believe and put our trust in God, and I guess that is what we have to do.  We must be needed in heaven for a reason, so I can only hope that there is a reason for this to be happening to your family.  You and your family are in our thoughts B.  Joey & Paul
My prayers are with your Aunt, Brian.

Every night as I close my eyes I will send a silent prayer to you and your family.  Your Aunt has a long road ahead of her, although from the sounds of it she has many loving people around her for a shoulder to cry on  and support when she will need it the most.  Sometimes that alone can cure a body and heal a soul.  Jen
